name: Hummus Place
address: 305 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA

reviews.text:
Never been to this place before even though it is walking distance from my home. Perhaps the fact that they are located in a basement made me overlook this hidden, small, warm and casual place.  My visit was to order hummus and pita to go however, and I left impressed by their menu. The food was delicious. I have eaten in a few Mediterranean places in the area, Yasouvlaki, Ella and Miriam, and let me tell you that this hummus was better. Creamy, tasteful and the right texture. Whenever you are in the Upper West Side, pay them a visit and enjoy.

I will post a full review of the place, other plates, service and atmosphere, when I return for a more formal meal.

â€œEat deliciously"
Love the service and food!!
Friendly service, authentic food. Super delicious ğŸ¤¤ a must for a humus lover ğŸ˜˜
Really excellent hummus, grape leaves, pita sandwiches, pickles, etc.

We went to this place after a good walk in Central Park. Itâ€™s 10 min walk from west side of CP. The food was amazing with everything felt super fresh and delicious. We tried the hummus platter and all of the different hummus varieties tasted amazing. Falafel were soft and fresh from inside. Would definitely recommend this place!
This is my go-to place for Mediterranean lunch or dinner. Great service and great food. Must try their falafel sandwich and hummus platter. The food will not disappoint you.
Some of the best falafel Iâ€™ve ever had. Fluffy and fresh pita too.
Everything was delicious

I want to start by saying that my family and I have been "regulars" at this place for at least 18 years - it's been our favourite Mediterranean spot food wise despite of rather simple interior - the place where hummus was "to die for" and 100% worth a commute from Brooklyn. The owners and staff were like family. It was always a warm, happy and yummy experience - until today.

My husband and I were so very looking forward to devouring delicious brunch - the usual poached eggs with eggplant for me, and eggplant Shakshuka for him. When we stepped inside the restaurant the first thing we noticed was strange smell inside - almost reminding me of a hospital which was a bit of a turn off but I brushed it off. The place was half empty on a Sunday afternoon which was rather unusual - especially because restaurant right across from it - Miriam - was full to the capacity . I also noticed that staff was COMPLETELY new - no one who we knew from years back was present. When the server arrived he was very neutral, matter of fact, nothing warm or pleasant about him. I placed my order but was already feeling uneasy. When the food arrived, and i started trying my eggs which used to always be amazingly tasty, beautifully complimented by juicy thick slice of eggplant and hummus - I was shocked to realize that eggs tasted mediocre and were far from what I was expecting, and the eggplant - a thin slice of eggplant per egg - was bland and tasteless! And to make things even worse, the  food arrived BARELY WARM - almost cold! The taste was 2/10 - just unbelievable! The hummus was excellent - but that was one tiny part of the large platter which was pretty much inedible! It is because of hummus I rated my experience as 2 and not 1! And side salad was all leaves - I have no idea what that even was!

And so in summary:
- both eggs - bland, cheap eggs hands down, no taste whatsoever.
- Eggplant - undercooked, tasteless, barely present.
- Food temperature - inappropriately cold further affecting the taste.
- Service-  below average.

I am baffled because I don't know the reason behind such disappointing experience - perhaps ownership has changed or the chef  -  I can only keep guessing ... but it is definitely a big difference and a huge disappointment.
Generous portions, high quality food, and authentic flavor
Nice place,  good food, like the original. Recommended.

TrÃ¨s bon rapport qualitÃ© prix
Une petit salle sympa, pas de musique assourdissante et pas de clim trop forteâ€¦ une exception Ã  New York et Ã§a fait plaisir

didnâ€™t really enjoy the hummus - tasted way too earthy. Falafel was average at best, it pretty much crumbled up when I tried to pick it up. pita was soft and chewy, and portions are huge for what youâ€™re paying though

We found a cockroach in our side salad. When we showed it to them, they dismissed it, saying it was just a salad bug, and even pointed out that we had already eaten the sandwich. I told them that if I had seen the bug first, I wouldnâ€™t have eaten anything. I definitely wonâ€™t be going back.
Not as good as it was before, but definitely better than average hummus
A vegetarian's dream!
Muy bueno. Situado en un bajo de la Av. Amsterdam, con un gran servicio y una carta hecha con buena materia prima y conocimiento de cocina. AdemÃ¡s, el ambiente y la clientela son muy agradables.
Definitely really solid falafels, and the humus was very tasty.
Fresh food and their Shakshouka is delicious. I will be back for more!
Delicious food, lovely service. They serve wine!
Legit place for Middle Eastern food.
Great food and good prices. Will be back if I am in the City.
Best vegetarian mid eastern cuisine in NYC
Falafel sandwich is the saltiest dish Iâ€™ve ever had
This is my wifeâ€™s favorite place to eat in NYC. The food is delicious!

I got the hummus platter to go. It was a large portion of hummus, with four different toppings, all of which were delicious. I think the mushroom was my favorite. It came with 2 pita, and the pitas were very fluffy and soft. However, 2 was not enough for this much hummus, so I wish I had gotten some extra pitas.
We ordered hummus and falafel plate and falafel sandwich. Both were really good. Fries, falafel and hummus all felt really fresh.
Great dishes & large portions! Be careful not to order too much
I tried their hummus and falafel, and it was everything you could wish for. Their pita bread smelled like heavenâ€”definitely the freshest pita Iâ€™ve ever eaten.
Always go here as soon as I arrive!

Brunch is good value with a lot of included sides and 2 drinks for less than $25

The rest of the menu is more expensive with less inclusions
Absolutely love this place! The hummus is incredible. Portions are generous, making it a great value for the price. Highly recommend for anyone craving delicious, fresh food!
so delicious
best hummus in nyc
Very cozy spot with one of the best brunch deals Iâ€™ve ever had. Shakshuka was ğŸ‘ŒğŸ‘ŒğŸ‘Œ
A small restaurant with great food and service. The food was so good that I would definitely come back again. We ordered two entrÃ©es and one appetizer, and we were absolutely full.
Delicious food. Excellent service.
Delicious eggplant hummus and eggplant shakshuka
Great food, delicious falafels and quick service! Ordered a falafel sandwich and liked it pretty much. The falafels were moist, not overly deep fried and yet crispy!
Amazing food! Loved the Shakshuka and hummus falafel! 11/10!
I go to Hummus Place for a meal that warms my soul!
GET THE CAULIFLOWER!!!!! So delicious. New fav israeli spot in nyc. Got couscous with hummus lunch special and side of cauliflower ğŸ˜½
Great little spot for a delicious afternoon pick me up if hummus and pita!
I really enjoyed my meal here. Very solid options and great for vegetarians/vegans. We liked the hummus, falafel and pita and the seasonal carrot and ginger soup was delicious.

Delicious food thatâ€™s great for folks who are vegetarian or vegan or love Mediterranean food

Most recently, we ordered veggie couscous, 3 sides: hummus, cauliflower, and falafel, and extra pita bread. Food was served quickly with great service.

I also love their Shakshuka, falafel sandwich, and soups
One of the go-to brunch places.
ÙØ·ÙˆØ± Ù„Ø°ÙŠØ° Ù„ÙƒÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø³Ø¹Ø§Ø± ØºØ§Ù„ÙŠÙ‡ Ø¬Ø¯Ø§Ù‹ Ø¬Ø¯Ø§Ù‹
Deeeelicious hummus. Very nice, cozy place with friendly staff. Highly recommend!

Absolutely amazing food. Quick service! Many vegetarian and gluten free options. We ordered the mezze and the hummus mushrooms with an extra side of pita and it was enough for 3 people. Well priced as well. Highly recommend if youâ€™re vegetarian or gluten free!

This place was a random pick for dinner and was disappointed when there was no meat on the menu.

Surprisingly all the dishes were delicious and we just ordered more and more.

Tried Eggplant shakshuka for the first time and it was good and it is similar to Indian eggplant curry with eggs.

Even though their fresh juice seems pricey, itâ€™s totally worth trying.

If you're craving for hummus, this is the place to go. It's one of the best I've ever had. The falafel was also delicious with a lot sauce. I'm not usually a fan of it, but this one made we want to have more. It was a great find for us since just found it off Google Maps as we were looking for a place for Hummus. We're so happy to have found the Hummus Place. One of the highlight or our trip. Thanks to the staff for the friendly service!

It was my first time visiting this place and I was absolutely blown away from the moment I walk in and sat down. The atmosphere was as absolute welcoming, the customer service experience was definitely ğŸ’¯, the food was insanely delicious and amazing. All together everything was perfect and I definitely recommend this place to anyone. 9.5/10

Basic but serviceable atmosphere. Staff is friendly and efficient. I got the hummus platter. In description it sounds more modest than it is. It was huge.
It's about an hour after eating and I'm still super stuffed. And I didn't even finish it. Anyway, if you want your hummus fix head here

Pretty good food at decent prices at this vegetarian only place that knows how to make healthier yet tasty dishes. They have a decent amount of indoor and outdoor seating.

Got the shakshuka and it was really good and paired well with their soft pita. The Malabi was also really good.

At the Hummus Hub on the Upper West Side, chickpea dreams take the stage. This place, amid city chaos, promises creamy indulgence and hummus escapades. My boyfriend and I on a Saturday afternoon scored an outdoor table right away â€“ a jackpot for any city dweller. Even though our waitress wasn't an example of great service, literally handed us napkins and spray to clean the table as we got seated, we didn't let it ruin our experience. Surrounded by friendly folks, the sun took the spotlight, officially marking its territory as brunch heaven. I opted for the Mallawach dish that won me over at $20 â€“ an edible treasure trove. My boyfriend went for the Shakshuka thrill at $18 â€“ eggs and spice galore. Each bite was full of flavor. Healthy and affordable â€“  Free OJ and tea with your entree, what a bonus! NYC's secret culinary gem.

Quick as a New York minute, The Hummus Place is a NYC must!

I am a fan of meditteraneandiet and extremely into hummus & babaganoush. We tried Hummus Place last week when we visited uwsnyc.

They are located at B1 and might be easy to miss. Surprisely, they have already been running for almost 20 years.

We shared Falafel Platter and 3 Meze Orders. The platter was served with various and delicious sides. It came with three pieces of pita which was served warm, soft and fluffy.

We got Cauliflower, Brussel Sproutsand Babaganoush as our 3 Meze Orders. Itâ€™s overall decent but the Brussel Sprouts were not our type.
Assolutamente WOW! Cucina medio orientale ottimamente eseguita. Lâ€™hummus Ã¨ favoloso, cosÃ¬ come anche le insalate e le omelette. Davvero un posto del cuore a NYC!

The food at this establishment is truly fantastic, and the service is top-notch as well. It's definitely worth making the trip to visit. The portions are huge, and I highly recommend trying the falafel and eggplant dishes!

Great place with good options. Went in for a Sunday brunch. Got an eggplant shakshuka which tasted great. The quantity was great for the price and good for two people. Also got a hot house tea, a good combination with the food.

Small vegetarian restaurant with delicious Israeli food!

I shared the hummus platter and got a falafel sandwich for myself. I definitely recommend splitting the hummus platter with a few people since its a lot of hummus for just 2. My favorite flavors were the tahini and mushroom.

The falafel sandwich was super tasty and the fries on the side were very crispy. I also really liked their house hot sauce, which was a green herbs paste.

For dessert, I got the vanilla rose flan which was plated nicely but unfortunately tasted a bit too artificially flavored.

Overall a great spot if youâ€™re looking for a quick and filling meal in UWS!

Delicious and creamy hummus, quite close to the one we had in Israel and one of the best in the city. The spinach shashuka was yummy, too. Pita bread was also great. We came back today after 5 years! Loved the meal. The Turkish coffee had a super lovely cardamon taste that was so aromatic. Liked the zatar pizza too had lots of nice flavors.

This place a small cozy place with fast service and tasty food. The portion size were decent and the falafel platter & hummus platter are a must try. The taboleh salad was also a good choice. The Mediterranean mojito is very refreshing. A nice place on west side for good food which isnâ€™t to heavy on pocket.

Highly recommend the egg sabich sandwich. Very filling, tasty, and healthy. The sauce that came with the fries was great too.

Perfect for a New York quick bite. Hummus was delicious too, with a stronger hint of tahini.

Wow. This place has some of the best falafel and shakshuka Iâ€™ve had!

I highly suggest going for brunch on a weekend as they have some options that come with a combination of several things.

We got one of their brunch shakshukas (2 eggs in a tomato sauce) as well as a side order of babaganoush (eggplant dip) and falafel (fried chickpea balls).

The main dish came with sides of salad, hummus, pita, roasted potatoes, orange juice, and your choice of coffee or tea. It is a great value for what you get.

The hummus is excellent - so smooth and lightly seasoned so you can enjoy the freshness of the ingredients. Paired with pillowy-soft pita, itâ€™s an excellent side.

The salad is good - nothing too special about it.

Roasted potatoes are good - nothing special about this either.

Shakshuka is amazing. The eggs are served over easy, and a generous amount of piping hot and chunky tomato sauce are spread all around. I highly suggest cutting the eggs to let the egg yolk mix with the tomato sauce and cook a little with it. This dish doesnâ€™t have too many spices as you are really supposed to enjoy the simple flavors of the eggs and tomatoes.

The falafel was excellent. Some of the best falafel I have had. So soft and moist on the inside and excellent flavors, including the little sauces they put on the plate itself.

The babaganoush was good. Nothing to mind blowing from other ones Iâ€™ve tried around the city. Personally I donâ€™t think the quality of this that you get is worth the nine dollars that you pay.

In the end, this was an excellent restaurant to enjoy some really good food. I definitely recommended if you are in the area!

Absolutely delicious, Vegan options available, big portions, fast service.
Outside place had roof and windshield, heater but also fans. There was a restroom as well next to the kitchen.

Paid 20usd for the large plates (hummus plate, falafel plate).. received large portions, could not finish our plates although were super hungry.
Definetly recommend trying it out.
I love the hummus here. The babaganoush is good too. I come here when I want something quick and light. I wish their fries were better. The salads donâ€™t seem that fresh.
Buena relaciÃ³n calidad-precio. TenÃ­an opciones sin gluten como las que ves en mis fotos. Servicio excelente

Great food! The best hummus Iâ€™ve ever had, and very vegan friendly. I like to get the falafel platter with assorted meze (see photo). Great for two to share. Been going to this place for years and every time itâ€™s fantastic!
Rumored to be the best hummus and falafel in New York, we had to check it out. We are convinced of the truth of this assertion.
Hummus Place is a good option to have Hummus and Falafel dishes. Is it the best falafel place hands down? No. The Hummus is very good though. I found that everything had a touch too much Salt.â€¦

Such a gem in the upper west side. We were hungry after spending the morning in Natural History Museum and decided to look for a place nearby. Itâ€™s a small and cozy restaurant with wonderful outdoor seating! We god the eggplant shakshuka and a brunch option. They were quite generous with the portions and it was delicious! I really enjoyed the shakshuka and the Turkish tea. Itâ€™s very popular, so the staff be get quite busy; be sure to have some amount of time to eat. Alternatively, you could do takeout. Wonderful experience, would come again!

Great restaurant!
The service was really good. The restaurant is small, by cozy.
We order the brunch menu, which includes a main dish + hummus + bread + salad + fries + coffee or tea + orange juice.
The shakshuka was AMAZING, as well as the hummus and the fries.
I would definitely recommend this restaurant as a breakfast option. Great food, great price and great service.

A hidden gem (or maybe not) thatâ€™s well worth the experience for the price and quality alone. We came here after walking around the neighborhood and was able to get a seat right away on a Sunday evening. Everything was delicious and came out fresh. The wait was a little long but there were quite a few people out. Would highly recommend this place - canâ€™t wait to come back soon!

Cute small little restaurant with really good food! Loved the spices that they had and the bread was soo warm and delicious. Really loved the flavoring on Hummus. Service was good as well. Cute little spot with really good food!

The food here is so fresh and flavorful. The lunch special was substantialâ€”butternut squash soup was delicious, and the eggplant sandwich was large and packed with flavor in every bite. The pita bread was warm and soft. And the staff were very accommodating!

their brunch platters are amazing â€” generous portions for just $25 per person.
the place is small in a partially underground space. came in on sunday at opening time and there was plenty of tables and fast service.
got the shakshuka with eggplant and spinach and it was divine. excellent hummus as well.

If you have a craving for hummus, you have to come here. You can go wild on their different variations but of course it's the hummus and pita bread itself that matters. I also highly recommend one of their tea as for me this is a perfect combo. The experience is really close to dedicated places I've visited in the middle east.

Background: I generally never liked hummus and they actually forgot a dish, BUT THEY STILL GET 5 STARS!!! I should have taken a picture before but I started inhaling the food. They must have put some uncut crack in this because it was justâ€¦

This place surprised me when I first time came here to have a Mediterranean dinner even though everything was vegetarian! It was sooo good! We ordered Hummus; cauliflower, beet salad, and roasted eggplant!

However, the second time here, the brunch smoked salmon was not good enough though - I DON'T recommend ordering it; My Friend said the roasted eggplant one was good though.

Would recommend it here for a healthy Mediterranean meal!!

Hummus Place gives Mamouns a run for their money.

Their falafel sandwich was ğŸ¤Œ. They layer the ingredients in the sandwich which makes for great bites. The hummus gets wrapped around on the inside of the pita, then they add veg salad, dressing, sauces and falafel pieces and repeat until the sandwich is full.

The pita - so soft and fluffy - I personally really liked the whole wheat and couldnâ€™t tell a huge difference.

The falafel - very green (which I tend to think is a good thing, more herbs, flavorful), soft and not very fried; they also pack them in nicely and donâ€™t skimp which makes it great in every bite as initially mentioned

The sauces - fire. Itâ€™s like a blend of a few - a dressing for the chopped tomato and cucumber, tahini, a green sauce and hummus. Makes it so flavorful and moist.
The veg add a nice subtle crunch and health.

I ordered mine with mixed green salad which I would recommend for one person unless youâ€™re splitting a pita sandwich with someone in which fries may help get you both full.

Very much so recommend this spot. I am definitely planning to come back

This is my to go place whenever I crave for Malawach or hummus! They are experts to me for both because the best versions I had ever. I am going this place at least every month I feel like. The only criticism Iâ€™d state is, I wish they have a normal size of glass for orange juice, it is coming in a tiny glass.

Accidentally, I found this place on my way from the American Museum of Natural History. I consider myself to be fond of Mediterranean cuisine since the beginning of the pandemic. I should admit that the hummus platter turned out to be quite large for one to deal with, but so amazingly delicious that I paused, only having finished the fourth flavor with mushrooms. I have never thought that someone would supercede the Presidio KEBAB in San Francisco in serving hummus. But the Hummus Place did. Baklava was very good, too, but, subjectively, could be softer.
